Reviews.Title: “perfection”
Reviews.Author: francesanne
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Alpharooms at a very reasoable rate and was just bowled over by how wonderful it was. The hotel is just a short walk from the central bus station, overlooking a small quiet canal. We were lucky enough to have room 105 which has a small balcony overlooking the canal. The room itself was newly refurbished, very large, with flat screen tv - the only English channel we found was BBC World News - tea/coffee, mini bar, safe, very comfy beds and immaculate bedding. The en suite bathroom was huge, with lovely towels and toiliteries and a door off the bathroom led to a large shower room/toilet. Breakfast was buffet style,plentiful but rather basic. The staff were absoluteluy outstanding and could not have been more helpful. A word of warning, we took the water bus from the airport, this took ages and deposited us in completely the wrong part of the city. For a fraction of the price we could have got the regular bus service, which was far quicker and stopped very near the hotel. We bought 36 hour water bus passes and visited 3 nearby islands as well as the Lido, St Mark's Sq and many other attractions - excellent value, although generally I found Venice far more expensive than Rome or Florence. If you are considering a trip to Venice, you could not do better than stay at this marvellous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't choose it again”
Reviews.Author: FFF666
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the "Al Sole" for 2 nights. The good points: Very nice location, close to everything, but quiet enough to have good rest. Very nice view from the room. (see picture) Impressive building. It is a really nice place!!! The very bad points: Bad service. the first morning we left the room at 10 am, leaving the keys at reception. The room was still not done at 4 pm. They wanted to do it at 16:30 while we were having some rest. Awful breakfast: One of the worst breakfast I've ever had. everything is bad, fake powder orange juices, machine milk, bad bread and cakes, etc... regards

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, nice atmosphere, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kraut55
Reviews.Content: Great location just 10 minutes walk from the busstation Piazzale Roma (especially if you arrive at night time and are not familiar with the area!). We paid â‚¬60.00 per night which we consider a really good deal. The room was small and had no view but was clean. The hotel is located in an old venetian palace and full of atmosphere. Breakfast buffet was good, especially if one remembers the typical breakfast Italian hotels used to serve not too long ago. Juices, cereals, rolls, coffee machine with lots of choices etc. etc. Very nice and helpful staff. The icing on the cake: halfway between the Piazzale Roma and the hotel is the #1 (out of more than 600) rated restaurant in Venice, which is actually just a hole in the wall, standing room only, but serves great rolls with ham, cheese, sausage and wine/prosecco each for just â‚¬0.60 to â‚¬1.20 (Bacareto da Lele). You have to go there!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: DocRosy
Reviews.Content: Booked a living social deal. Great location. Spent a really lovely 4 nights in this hotel. We were booked into a superior canal view room. Staff were helpful, and the room delightful. Comfortable good sized bed. Breakfast simple but good quality. No complaints at all. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but sweet”
Reviews.Author: Cconti
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at Hotel al sole. Our room was basic, simple but very clean. The Hotel is located in a traditional Venician building and it's full of character. The location is perfect - near Piazzale Roma and waterbus links, plus close to many delicious osterias and patisserie. The staff was very kind and helpfull. Good value for money. Only minor let down was breakfast, that although good, could be better considering all the delicious sweet and savoury options Venice's coffee shops have to offer.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, REALLY NICE STAY”
Reviews.Author: shirl024
Reviews.Content: Myself and my family, party of 6 of varying ages, stayed in this hotel in December 2011. We had superior canal rooms. The rooms were not huge but adequate and although a little noisey on the first floor I would deffinate recommend canal views as you see local life going by. Reception and breakfast room very nice given the age of the building and looks exactly like the photographs on the website. Breakfast nice but have had better. Great location walking distance to main arrival square bus and train station and to the local water taxis. Great staff, we would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Still Undecided on Al Sole”
Reviews.Author: LanarkshireTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the final leg of our Italy honeymoon. On arrival the location is very good being close to the station and also in an idyllic spot. The reception was nice however we were disappointed with our room. It was a large room but very dated and in need of repair. We know that most hotels in Venice are dated but this one felt unhealthy and smelt unpleasant. When we spoke to reception they explained that this was normal for Venice however we did not feel comfortable in room so they eventually moved us and what a difference. The room we were moved to was smaller and still dated inside but was so much cleaner and fresher. No paint coming off the walls and no damp smell!. We felt much more comfortable in this room. We enjoyed our stay here and were comfortable although compared to the other hotels we stayed in during our trip this was by far not the best but maybe thats the norm in Venice. We also felt their wasn't much of a choice at breakfast but there are so many cafes close by that we preferred eating out in the morning. Again, great location though doubt if I would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Nice position, lovely exterior, very tired interior, awful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jeffrey57
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel, because it was close to the station, easy to find - and looked nice. I paid 200 euros per night for a superior room for 31st December 2011 and 1st Jan 2012. The reception area looks lovely - just like the pictures on the website. My bedroom though, was very dark, plain beige emulsioned walls (20 years ago), with a depressing print on the wall, as the only decoration and heavy brocade curtains. It was large enough, but felt like a prison cell it was so depressing. The tiny bathroom was very dated - probabaly late 60s mottled green and white ceramic tiles. The shower was wide but not very deep. The shower mechanism was in the middle of the shower. It had a handle that pulled outwards for temperature and flow. As you turned to wash, you either pushed it off, or towards the hot or cold - giving you quite a shock. The shower head was on a bar, which kept slipping down to chest height. To have a shower,you had to huddle into a corner, but the flow and temperature once adjusted and not knocked was fine. I went down to reception before unpacking, to ask if I could have a nicer room - I was paying 200 euros a night ! I was told very firmly that this was a 500 year old Palazzo, not an American hotel, I was in a Superior room, there was nothing better. They obviously thought the hotel was perfect and I was just a miserable complainer that knew no better ! There was nothing inside the building 500 years old, and my room was definitely no older - nor newer - than the 1980s ! I was in Venice - where you do not expect good value anyway. Breakfast ! The worst I have had in any hotel in Italy. This is the first hotel, where I have not been greeted to breakfast, nor offered a coffee or Cappucino. There was an 'office' style machine, to help yourself. The coffee was not what you expect in Italy. Catering brown stuff, is the only way I can describe it. It was undrinkable. I tried the hot chocolate, but that was as bad. There were Cona carafes, but they had 'brown stuff' in as well. No selection of local breads, only some small white, soft, flavourless catering rolls. There were croissants, both filled and unfilled and some bruised and rough looking fruit. Meats ? Nothing local and certainly not from a charcuterie. A small amount of pink salami and soft ham. Nothing local, nothing superior - all supermarket produce. I left hungry and very unimpressed. I have stayed in much cheaper hotels, who have made the effort to offer a wonderful breakfast. Here, they just could not be bothered and it shows. Venice itself ? I have been going to Venice for the past 40 years. It used to be a living city. It's faded grandeur - it's charm. It was always a mecca for tourists, but maintained a nice balance. That is no longer the case. It has been cleaned up and is now 100% tourism. There are no ordinary shops. Only glitzy mardi gras masks, or cheap Swarovski crystal jewellery / paintings from the Far East that you can buy on Ebay, for a few pounds. There are some Murano / expensive china shops, but they only contain tourist souveniers. Nearer the Piazza San Marco, you have the Bond Street stores. The Doges palace and San Marks is always worth a visit, but I won't be going back. They have cleaned up the buildings and instead of painting them traditionally, with a stucco washed effect, they are now painted with modern exterior paints, so they are clean, bland and glaring - just like anywhere else. Food and drink is good and not much more expensive than the rest of Italy. Venice though - such a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel but service is average”
Reviews.Author: ChaitanyaS
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located although I think better located would be near the museum as that part is alive till late night. It depends on personal choice. The service is average and the room I got was quite small. for the price I was payin I expected a better and bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “BACK AGAIN SO MUST BE GOOD”
Reviews.Author: DerekMHowarth
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Venice in 2011 and where else would we go but back to Room 111 at the Al Sole. The standards remain just the same and although not the cheapest around the area, certainly very comfortable, clean and great position on a small canal and close (walking distance) to the Pza Roma bus station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Beautiful view on to tranquil canal. Friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: KandNinLK
Reviews.Content: Stayed there as a couple for weekend late november. Had double room with canal view .....excellent veiw. which was a good side wth separate room area which has tea and coffee and couch in for relaxing in. room was a bit run down with marks on walls and wee broken skirting board....but never mind, the long 15th centaury windows and friendly staff made up for it. Breakfast is continental. Coffee,cold meats,bread rolls ,juices serial etc. inside when we where there but outside garden did look beautiful for summer breakfasts. 5 mins walk from bus stop of where you will be left of if you get bus from airport. Also great square called campo san margretta also 5 mins walk away. late opening bar next door too:) al carcan.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: iloveholidays50
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sol is within a beautiful old building, a former palace, in a quiet, charmbing street with a tributary of the Grand Canal righ outside. It is very easily reached from the Bus station and believe me, when you visit Venice you need a hotel very easily found because the streets are equivilent to a few maze's placed over one another and your internal compass quickly looses all meaning and cannot be relied upon! The hotel is spotlessly clean and beautifully decorated. The continental breakfast buffet is huge and any emptying baskets are briskly and immediatly filled by the competent waitress. I was amused to note that the italians all took their hot drinks from the automatic, chemical filled!, dispenser and and did not partake of the two freshly prepared, continually filled, fresh filter coffee pots! We were given a room on the second floor, we did not have any view other than the opposite wall across a very small courtyard. The room was spotlessly clean and contained a king bed and a single bed and was decorated in dark, muted colours of blue and green. We received a complementary bottle of fizz, don't know why, perhaps because we had requested a double bed with a view and got neither! but it was good! Ther is even scented toilet paper! The hotel is situated on a very beautiful, quite street, there is a small bar also serving snacks immediatly next door and small shops, resturants and a bakery also near. It is nicely situated to walk into the centre, along the Grand Canal and there is yet another of the many routes to reach St. Mark's square at the end of the street. Sometime during this year, a Tourist Tax was introduced, I think it works out at 1.50 Euro per person per night (we are a couple and stayed two nights and were charged 6 euros's) and they hit you with this at check-out! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this beautiful hotel in beautiful Venice and can highly recommend visiting both.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: catalina66
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant place to stay. It's in a great location on a quiet, charming street, away from all the crowded tourist traps but close enough to walk to them all. It's also within walking distance of many of the lesser known attractions. It's very close to the train station and bus station and various vaporetto stops, but don't let that put you off! Venice is not like other cities and while I generally avoid areas near train/bus stations in other cities, 5 minutes from the transport hub here brings you into the real Venice. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the breakfast was good, in particular the freshly baked croissants (the wholemeal variety was very welcome). The room was a good size and very clean. The bathroom also was roomy and clean. I asked for a quiet room and on the whole I had a quiet stay - a strange clanking sound always began around 7am which I think may have been the lift, but it didn't bother me. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again if returning to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Amazing City”
Reviews.Author: Rocknroller99
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel in probably the most amazing city I have ever stayed in. Folk have waxed lyrical about the miracle of Venice for centuries now, so there is little that I can add except to say that if it is sinking, then I'd urge everyone to make at least one trip there before it is lost forever. The Hotel Al Sole is brilliant - clean, spacious with really helpful English speaking staff which is brilliant for all lazy non second language Europeans (i.e 90% of all Brits!) We had a canal view room with a small balcony and it was definately worth booking this in advance - fantastic to wake up and watch the world go by on their boats first thing in the morning. Breakfast (as mentioned by others) was lovely with an unlimited cold buffet. Two items that the Al Sole does undersell itself on which are really good plus points ........ first is location. It's less than five minutes walk from the bus station (Piazalla Roma?) which is as far into the city as you can get by motor vehicle. After that you need to either walk, gamble with the water bus (cheap but confusing to use) or throw away all of your holiday money on a gondola ride. We could easily have booked a hotel on the other side of the city without realising it and had a nightmare getting there from the bus station. (Buses run from Marco Polo airpot very regularly to Piazalla Roma and cost just 5 euros). Second plus point is the double glazing to all hotel windows and balcony doors. Venice is suprisingly noisy so it was great to be able to close off the noise and crash out in peace and quiet at the end of a long day's exploring. Spent four days in Venice altogether, Brilliant city, lots to see and do. All restaurants are fabulous, with some great ones very close to the hotel. Only downside is that Venice must be one of the most expensive places on the planet to either visit or live, but then I guess the hanging gardens of Babylon would probably charge a few quid over the odds as well. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Former Palazzo,still a Palace”
Reviews.Author: ejfraser
Reviews.Content: Staff efficient but very friendly. Beautiful hotel with excellent location for anyone making there own travel arrangements from airport. Very good buffet breakfast. Plenty of eating places nearby . Ideal location for access to 2 main stops on Grand Canal , Train station and Bus station for travel further afield or within Venice itself. Will stay here again when we return to Venice. VENICE IS A MUST VISIT PLACE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Room with A View”
Reviews.Author: Emmpeez
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Al Sole for just two nights en route to Rome and enjoyed the comfort and hospitality, as well as the location at Al Sole. The hotel promised a 10 minute walk from the train station and they were right. Just one bridge to cross (it's a big one!) and a gentle walk along the canals to Al Sole. We were given Room 103, over looking the canal where we people watched and gondola watched. We were lucky to see a couple of gondola tours with an opera singer to boot. The room was comfortable with a good bed and bathroom with shower stall. Probably not the largest room they have, but not small either. The view would be hard to beat though. Very little noise in the hotel, although if you sleep with the windows open the nice from the street may disturb as the restaurants and bars close. Breakfast was great, with typical pastries, yoghurt, fresh fruit, meats and cheese - just what you would expect from a continental breakfast. Too cool in the mornings for the terrace to be open, but it looked delightful. Staff were always on hand, even late one evening when I asked for another pillow and sent the poor guy running through the hotel to find one. Overall, reasonably priced, good location and comfortable. Would certainly recommend and will likely return ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Sunny636
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for two reasons, based upon Trip Advisor reviews and also that is was within a 5 minute walk of the Piazalle Roma which is where the airport shuttle would drop us off. Well I wasn't disappointed!! We arrived in Venice and it was absolutely pouring with rain. So we arrived at the hotel at 11am wet and tired (we'd been up since 4am as we had a 6:30am flight out), wondering how our early arrival would be greeted. All I can say is, what great staff. They were so friendly and helpful and by the time we'd gone through the check-in process (which was quick and fuss free) our room was ready. We were escorted to our room by a porter who then showed up our room facilities, informed us of the contact numbers for the reception and reiterated that they were available 24 hours to help if required. The room itself if nice. Not overly big but as our trip was about having an explore of Venice, clean and comfortable was our main requirements and if definitely met this. One note to any ladies reading this review (or guys reading and reporting back to their better halves!) the hotel does provide a hairdryer.....however, its one of those that's in the bathroom, attached to a wall and to be honest would probably take several hours to actually dry long hair and forget blow-drying. So if you need/want to use a hairdryer I'd suggest taking your own. As we'd been up early on our arrival day we returned to the hotel around 10pm and thought we'd have a nightcap in the hotel bar, only to be told it was closed. I can't comment on the bar-hours as after that we used the bar next door as our night-cap venue. The window has external shutters which was quite disorientating the first morning we were there as we woke up in the pitch black but feeling wide awake. Upon checking my phone it was 8:45! So if a darkened room is a must for a good nights sleep, you can be guaranteed of that! Our board basis was bed and breakfast and breakfast is available 7:30 - 10:30. Its self service and the food provided was typical continental fayre but plenty of it, lots of fresh coffee and delicious home made croissants (I'd recommend the wholemeal and honey ones, amazing, no need for any additional jam). We were out for full days of sightseeing, but did opt to come back for a quick power nap before going out for the evening and the only observation I'd make is that if you were looking for a quiet relax/snooze then you may find the foot traffic in the corridors a bit intrusive. It may just have been that we were staying at the same time of heavy footed-door slammers but we certainly new that there was hustle and bustle in the corridors. Very minor point, but if an afternoon snooze is a must for you to enjoy your evening then take some ear-plugs just to err on the side of caution. Check-out was simple and the hotel was more than happy to look after our bags for us, whilst we made the most of our final day of exploring. I'd definitely go back to Hotel Al Sole if I returned to Venice and would most surely recommend it to friends and fellow travellers. A couple of points if you've never been to Venice: We arrived at Marco Polo Airport and took the Airport Shuttle coach to Piazalle Roma. This is good value at â‚¬18 return, they run frequently and it takes about 20 minutes. Buy your ticket in the airport before you exit the terminal building. Vaporetto is a great way of getting around. We opted for the 48 hour ticket at â‚¬28 euros, sounds a lot but great value. Validate on your first trip and that's when your 48 hours starts from. We used route 1 firstly to get our bearings, which is all stops down the grand canal (from PR to the Lido) and takes about an hour. Once you get familiar with the routes, you can use the alternate lines which are more direct and obviously take less time to get to where you want to go. One advantage of staying near Piazalle Roma is many routes stop here so we could go anywhere around the islands on the Vaporetto route and if we were tired after a days adventures and wanted an easy route home, we made our way to the nearest Vaporetto stop.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: donnajzb
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our group of 13 touring Italy. They gave us an excellent price for the group and could not have been more helpful. The public areas are lovely and the hotel is close to the train station in a nice neighborhood. Our rooms were clean and nicely decorated with a view of the canal. The staff helped us with dinner reservations for the group at a resteraunt close by and arranged transportation to the train station for one of our group who had some difficulty walking. The breakfast in the garden was a great way to start the day. They could not have been more helpful. We will stay here again when we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: elle090
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel to look at with great attention to detail in the decoration of the communal areas. Our bedroom was a reasonable size but with a large bed which was very comfortable. We had paid extra for a room with a view over the canal and it was worth the extra money as it was lovely to watch the gondalas sailing past. We selected the hotel as it is only about 10 minutes walk ( long enough dragging cases ) from Piazzale Roma where the taxi from the airport dropped us and the same from the train station from which we continued our journey. It is approx 20 minutes walk from St Mark's square and has a couple of decent restaurants within five minutes walk of the hotel. The worst aspect of the hotel was breakfast where there was very little choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, nothing bad to say at all.”
Reviews.Author: Cedric U
Reviews.Content: Location is great. Near the trains and buses and slightly away from the worst of the tourist crowds but everything reachable by foot in 10-15 mins. Staff were great, views great, garden / breakfast area great. Rooms were nice with no issues. Everything worked, good water pressure / temperature etc. Everyone speaks enough English and the staff were so helpful, I can't say enough. I was there for national transportation strike. You can imagine the stress but they took care of all the Italian call and helped with train advice. They were great. If you can find cheaper it's up to you but if the prices are similar you can't beat this place. I'll stay again if I make it back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A cool haven in hot summertime venice”
Reviews.Author: margmcr
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Al Sole on a recommendation from a family member. Turned out to be the nicest hotel we stayed in on our European trip. Close to the train station and the ferries on the main canal, so location was perfect. Staff were very friendly and spoke excellent English. The breakfast was delightful, out in the vine covered courtyard. The room was small but adequate, overlooking the courtyard. Lovely bathroom. Would definitely stay here again & will be recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: CClarke74
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at a cost of Â£130 per night for a double room. The room was a good size, the bed was large and comfortable and the bathroom was modern and clean. The decoration was traditional Venice, shutters at window, very high ceilings and quiet sparse furniture. It was difficult finding a luxury hotel in Venice without spending a fortune, so I thought for Â£130 a night we would get a decent hotel. It was decent, but certainly nothing special. We had no view at all, just the back of buildings which all looked quite shabby so that was a shame and part of the wall was in need of painting or decoration. But then all of venice is in need of decoration. It's an old city filled with warmth and character. Walking through the endless maze of streets is enchanting and magical and I loved Venice so much. I would probably spend a bit more money next time on a better hotel, but all in all a fantastic break. The 'continental' breakfast was great, with fruit, cereal, croissants etc served and eaten in the beautiful courtyard garden. The hotel will give you a map which is also very useful. Hundreds of bars and restaurants to choose from so no need to book.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: cadebbie521
Reviews.Content: The Al Sole is a great hotel with all the ambience of Venice. We stayed here for a few nights before our cruise. The hotel is very close to Piazzale Roma and the cruise terminal. It sits on a quiet canal, but you get the feel of Venice with delivery boats and gondolas. Our room was clean and comfortable with a view of the courtyard. The continental breakfast which was included was simple but good.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: de_lymer
Reviews.Content: After quite a bit of research to find the ideal Venice hotel which had the charm without breaking the bank- Hotel Al Sole certainly did not disappoint. We were in Venice for a seven day cruise and arrived the day before - deciding to stay in a hotel closer to the cruise ship marina. Before boarding our ship we had a few hours to explore Venice and decided to have a look at our pad for our return journey, Hotel Al Sole. The walk to the hotel from Piazzale Roma was under five minutes just having to cross two bridges and walking along the canal. Located in a very peaceful part of Venice yet with all the amenities you need close by. The exterior of the hotel with its exposed brick, white stone arches and wooden shutters makes it one of the most picturesque buildings in the area. The bridge which sits at the front of the hotel makes it the ideal picture postcard â€“ as many tourists realised. The canal at the front of the hotel is calm with not many boats. But in saying this you are never far from a gondola ride as there were two who sat just outside the hotel. After our fantastic cruise it was time to lug our baggage over the two bridges to Hotel Al Sole â€“ I really didnâ€™t know why I packed so much. As we entered the foyer with its exposed beams, polished tiled floors and beautiful antique furniture we were greeted by very attentive staff who spoke excellent English. As we had arrived too early for check-in were able to leave our bags - which were locked in their luggage room - and they ensured that we were well equipped with a map to explore Venice. To our surprise they had a complimentary water taxi to Murano every morning at 10am â€“ provided that there was a minimum of four willing guests - to visit the glass factory and see the glass blowing. This we took up on the following day. When we returned to the hotel we were ushered to room 105 and soon realised that we had been upgraded from a garden view to a canal view with small balcony. The room was massive, as was the bed and not to mention the bathroom â€“ which had two of everything with the exception of a toilet. We were elated!!!! The room was outfitted with a king size bed â€“ which was firm but comfortable â€“ closet, safe, desk with mirror, mini-bar, television â€“ unfortunately no English channels -, free standing lamp â€“ which didnâ€™t work for some reason â€“ and bedside tables. The bathroom which was two in one had two sinks, a shower unit, a bathtub with shower attachment, a bidet, toilet, toiletries, hairdryer and all the towels you can ask for. The room was fully air-conditioned and also had an air fresher unit which added to the ambiance. The highlight of the room had to be the view. The French doors lead to a small balcony which overlooked the canal and street below which harnessed the evening sun. Breakfast was continental and there was lots of it. Three different types of croissants, bread rolls, cereals, yoghurts, a selection of cheeses, deli meats and boiled eggs. There was also filtered coffee and juices but my fav had to be the automated drinks machine which served everything from cappuccino to mocha. We sat in the beautiful outdoor garden with vines overhead enjoying our lovely meal and set for the day ahead. There was a small pub next to the hotel and also a restaurant close by. The walk to Rialto Bridge and San Marco is about a 45 minutes â€“ given the crowds you have to contend with in the narrow streets. We thoroughly enjoyed our time at Hotel Al Sole and will definitely return to this true gem in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PaulMarsacala_Malta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated about 10 minutes away by walk from Piazzale Roma. Very beautiful surroundings with a canal passing in front and gondolas available outside the hotel main door. Rialto bridge and Piazza San Marco are about 30 minutes away by walk. The Hotel Italian staff are very helpful and have no problem in speaking English and French. Breakfast is buffett continental and typical Italian good quality and can be taken indoors or outside in a well kept patio. The effficient breakfast room assistant cleaned the tables as soon as the guests took off and changed the table cloths every time. We spent 3 nights in all. 2 nights before joining a cruise and 1 night after. The first room was at the back. Medium size room and shower and very quite. The second room was at the front slightly smaller than the first and even smaller shower cubicle. But the view from the window on the canal compensated for these drawbacks. Both rooms were very clean and air conditioned. The a/c in the first room was a little noisy. My wife and I will certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel , good location”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaBrazil
Reviews.Content: The Al Sole In Venice is a great hotel. I stayed there for 5 days. The location is good, just 10 minuts walking to the mais atractions. The staff was very kind, on the first day after a check-in they gave us a map and explain how to rich the main atractions. If you want to go to Murano they provide a transportation. My room was nice and clean, but I think it could have a closet. There was a small space to hang the clothes. The breakfast was very good. You can choose to have it inside or outside in a beautiful garden. If I return to Venice , I'm sure I'm going to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is old in Venice”
Reviews.Author: CinderellaV
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Venice, we had no idea what to expect. We disembarked the cruise ship with my in-laws and found it difficult to get directions in English. Without purchasing an excursion bus fare, we were on foot. We walked over a couple highway overpasses to the bus terminal which is on the outskirts of Venice and found the hotel quickly and easily with our map. The hotel was charming as was the front desk staff who spoke perfect English. The rooms were small but clean. We especially enjoyed the courtyard breakfast area. As with every building in Venice, it needed some repair. The floors were uneven, the hairdryer was broken, but they did have an elevator. The location was good, close to the Vaparetto. All in all, it was a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Al Sole still excellent price/quality”
Reviews.Author: jpver
Reviews.Content: I was already in 2008 the first time in this hotel. Meanwhile I have sent several friends to it. As we were again for a cruise a few days before, we have chosen to go back. Indeed, the location is simple excellent from Piazale Rome where you have the buses, Vaporetto and now the People mover to the cruise terminal. The hotel is an excellent 3 stars. People at the reception are friendly and helpfull. As we boarded only in the afternoon, the luggage could stay free of charge in the locker. Rooms are clean, with fridge and airco. OK some are in the front and others at the back with less view. The breakfast buffet is absolutely honnest!!! Recommend it again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in an excellent location..”
Reviews.Author: SuaimhneasDe
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this charming hotel for 3 nights. Excellent location (take a bus from the airport to Plaza Roma - 5 mins walk from there.) The rooms are quiet spacious for Venice (for any European city !) - there was a double and a sofa bed in our room with loads of space. Right outside the main hotel entrance are some gondola "taxis". Lovely outside garden for breakfast in the morning - really enjoyed our stay, will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Pilbeam
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a three night stay on our honeymoon. We initially selected it for its closeness to the station (we were arriving on the Orient Express), location outside of the tourist hotspots and the fact it had both canal frontage and a garden/courtyard. The instructions provided by the hotel for finding it were not too accurate but it is a relatively short walk from both the train and bus station without many bridges. The hotel has a good location on a small canal with several small bars, cafes and restaurants close by. Reception was efficient and manned 24 hours. Initial impressions were very good with the place being exactly what we expected for a traditional Venice hotel. Our room at the front of the hotel, overlooking the bridge, was spacious and comfortable, sparsely furnished and decorated maybe but this was not a negative. A good sized bathroom with shower, bath and bidet was particularly welcomed. The room had a safe, minibar and reasonable hanging space (although not many coat hangers). One thing to take note of with our room was that although on the first floor, people crossing the small bridge we overlooked were roughly at our window height and had an unrestricted view in (unless the shutters and net curtains were in use). We enjoyed breakfast in the courtyard under the vines. We accept some previous reviewer's comments that the breakfast has a restricted choice but as we were staying only three days it was not a problem for us. Next to the hotel is a very small bar where we enjoyed late evening drinks watching the world go by. In all, a very enjoyable stay and we would not hesitate recommending this hotel to anyone who wants to visit Venice but not stay in the very crowded, touristy areas elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Location was great, not far from bus station and people mover (only 2 small bridges).”
Reviews.Author: KELLY040251
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a great locaton, away from the crowds, but still on a main thorough fair. It is close to the bus station and people mover and only about a 15 minute walk from the railway station. Rooms are good and clean, especially the Garden Rooms (very good value). Staff were helpful and they offer a free trip to Murano (but it comes wth a visit to a glass blowing factory which is quite expensive but worth a visit). There are plenty of restaurants within close proximity, but there are more another 20 minutes walk away. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: babana
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and had a wonderful time. This area is best value for money and you can walk everywhere from the hotel in a short space of time. The hotel was beautiful and breakfast in the garden welcoming. Staff at times could have been a bit more helpful but otherwise great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: FebrynaW
Reviews.Content: Not far from Bus and train terminal. But you will need to prepare yourself with a map. The hotel is very old but clean. We had a room quite ok, but the bathroom was very small. The staff helped with the direction to help us go to St. Mark's Square. The breakfast was very standard. But overall its a nice hotel because of its location.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and cosy all in one”
Reviews.Author: ellie334
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Nothing bad to say at all. Staff friendly and welcoming. Rooms ok. Beds very comfrtable. Location great.Lots of lovely restaurants and bars nearby and the water bus only a few mins walk away

Reviews.Title: “A very good 3 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NikkiJ
Reviews.Content: This hotels crowning glory is its location and courtyard garden where you can have breakfast. Its situated in a quiet area of Venice not far from Piazzale Roma, which means a very short walk with cases. Its on a lovely canal with some great bars and restaurants nearby. Due to availability we could only book a standard room. The room was very small with a very small shower room which is really not a problem when staying just a few nights but I should imagine any longer it could get on your nerves. Mind you, at the same time you really don't spend alot of time in your room when visiting venice anyway. At breakfast there was a good selection but if you want hot food at breakfast then this isn't the place for you. Other than the room size my only complaint was not being able to get a drink from the bar at 10pm, there was only one person on duty at reception and she was unable to leave it and get us some drinks which I understand but why have a bar if it can't be used, having said that there is a small excellent bar next door. I would definately return again, mainly because if its location.

Reviews.Title: “fourth stay at this hotel and will go again”
Reviews.Author: fanantoosh
Reviews.Content: hotel has a fantastic location, near all the water bus stops, you can walk to san marco but quiet and venisian. the staff are the best part, so pleasant and helpful. they have handouts for buses and trains. they can recommend restaurants and book for you and you get the discount. the restaurants are well worth a recommendation. you really feel the staff want you to enjoy your visit to the full. its a great hotel and gets better each time we go. i have recommended this hotel so many times and all my friends agree it is excellent value and gives a great experience. that garden restaurant for breakfast and the canal outside are just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!”
Reviews.Author: DG00
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Piazzale Roma, Hotel Al Sole was only a short walk from there. It is far enough however that you are not even aware of it. We enjoyed being in the San Polo district as we were away from the touristy areas, and we were experiencing the real Venice. The building is attractive, and being situated on a canal near a bridge I spent hours people watching from our hotel window. The room was a nice size, though not terribly large. However the beautiful gothic stone windows and attractive decoration more than made up for it. You don't visit Venice and stay in your room! There is a lift, so if you've been walking all day you can treat your feet! The breakfast was continental with cereals, yoghurts, pastries, rolls, cheese, ham, fruit etc, plenty to eat. The staff are very polite and knowledgeable, and went out of their way to make the stay a comfortable one. We only stayed two nights, and will certainly return to Hotel Al Sole again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, the friendliest staff”
Reviews.Author: pinkbubbles68
Reviews.Content: Fab location (get the bus from airport for 6 euros return) to piazzale roma and very short walk then to hotel, situated on a small canal, surrounded by shops, restaurants and a short walk to Rialto, San Marco etc. Luigi on reception is excellent and the most helpful hotel staff member I have ever met and speaks english. Good breakfast selection, bread, cereal, croissants, ham, cheese, fruit etc. Rooms are basic but very clean (brick wall view unless you pay for garden view - but who needs a view in your room - get out and walk!).

Reviews.Title: “GORGEOUS”
Reviews.Author: JJR08
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the Aqua Alta prevented me from getting along the street to where I guessed the hotel was...there was nothing to do except take off my shoes and socks and roll up my trousers and wade over to the lobby - this too was flooded with 100mm of water...but the staff were calm and obviously used to it and reflecting upon it one is in Venice - so it made the experience genuine. Lovely room overlooking the canal. Shops nearby to stock up on bottled water and supplies. Great part of town near everything - and Venice is so delightfully small - walking everywhere, hearing watching people living: FABULOUS

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable, could do with a lick of paint”
Reviews.Author: little_L86
Reviews.Content: Location Close to the station, and being away from San Marco meant decent priced near restaurants nearby (definitely try Ribo, which is just down the road). Also close to campo santa margherita which was a cheap place to have a few drinks. Disadvantage is, as mentioned, quite far from main sights. It is a nice walk, but everyday, to and from, is tiring, particularly after a day of sightseeing. Waterbus feels quite expensive when you are not using it regularly and did not get a travel pass. Rooms: Nice, basic and perfectly adequate. TV with some news channels. Walls needed repainting. Bathroom was clean and towels etc changed everyday where asked. Floor was clean but looked a bit patchy. Lights quite dim but I generally found this in Venice. If you are not staying canal view, I wouldn't recommending sleeping with window open. I got bit badly by a mosquito both nights, and developed bad reactions to them. This is, of course, personal reaction, but any insect bite is better avoided! Staff: Generally good. There was a blonde lady on reception who when checking you in, would launch into a big tirade about where to get certain waterbuses, how to get to islands etc etc. Whereas this is all very useful information, and would have been good if one had done no research whatsoever, it was a waste of time where you had, and in particular if you were tired after travelling. It would be more helpful if she asked whether you wanted a guide first. And although it was good information, the general feeling from her was that she had to do this as part of her job. There was another gentleman on reception from time to time. I never found out his name, but he was v friendly without being pushy. He made reservations for our dinner, and was very helpful on our last day when the water was going to be rising by four feet. Breakfast: Good spread of food inc fruits, some meats, cereal, yoghurts, croissants, cheese, tea & coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother looking any further”
Reviews.Author: Pencillady
Reviews.Content: I spent hours looking for just the perfect place to stay for our anniversary trip to Venice. I found it!!! Our room was overlooking a canal that regularly had gondola's and seranaders going by. It was a short walk from the train station, which was a important factor after a full day of travel to get there. We could easily walk everywhere from our hotel. They were very friendly and accommodating. Breakfast was a wide variety of fresh food held in a quaint courtyard. The price was very fair. We couldn't have been happier there and will recommend the Hotel Al Sole to anyone we know going to Venice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Tita1953
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in the main area of Venice, but it is just a short lovely ride on a vaporetto to wherever you would like to be like St. Marks Square. It was quiet and very quaint to stay at. Most of all, the staff at the hotel was superb!! They made sure our stay was the best that it could be. They suggested reasonable places to eat near by and made sure we should give their name, so that they would treat us as "vip" customers and that is exactly how we felt upon the end of our meal. They arranged a trip to Murano in a wonderful taxi, which we would have never taken as it was expensive, but it was a service that the hotel provides. They gave suggestions where to eat on the island also. They provided us with our own personal guide to the Glass blowing factory. They set up our reservation so that my husband and I would have a romantic gondola ride at sunset the prime time to go. They negotiated the price and all we had to do was hop on board!! I would stay at no other place if I ever return. They even sent a porter to the drop off area where the bus dropped us off to help us with our luggage, so we wouldn't have to carry it. The morning breakfast was delicious and very fresh and it was a beautiful place to start the day!

Reviews.Title: “What a little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: spion
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights recently and what a gem of a hotel it is. From the bus terminus it is only a 5 minute walk.[ which was good as we arrived late evening and did'nt fancy getting lost.] Our room on the first floor was of a good standard, clean, lovely and warm, ok we didn't get the views overlooking the canal, but no complaints. Breakfast was typically continental serving until 10:30am, which was nice being able to have a lie in. There was no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, which the receptionist confirmed when I asked, which was slightly disapointing. But overall with the friendliness of the staff and location of the hotel I would return and stay here again and recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in wonderful and convenient location, with friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JocatOttawa
Reviews.Content: Our room was very comfortable, a pleasant reprieve from the heat and humidity of Venice in August. We were given an upgrade without asking, so had a lovely view of the canal from the window. Air conditioning was quiet and efficient (North American hotels should learn from this). The location near the Piazzele Romana was ideal for: - close to buses arriving from the airport; -close to water buses for exploring Venice; -close to cruise boats (important to us this trip); quiet for sleeping. Breakfast was very good and included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel..........very friendly”
Reviews.Author: peterunionave
Reviews.Content: The hotel was within easy walking distance from the bus station and railway station and we were welcomed warmly. The attractive historic building blends well with modern facilities and the continental breakfast was varied with plenty of it. The rooms are fairly standard rooms but only a few have canal views, our room looked out over a very smallcourtyard, there was a balcony but the view was not worth it, a previous stay had us overlooking the wall of the building next door, however, we liked the hotel so much that we returned despite looking at other hotels whilst there. The local area is relatively quiet with the Gaffaro canal running beside the hotel, aound twice a day four or five gondolas come past with an accodianist and singer entertaining the passengers, lovely !, a five minute walk gets you to the grand canal at Pizzale Roma from where the Vaporetti take you anywhere you need to go, we liked the idea of returning from the hustle of tourist spots to the peace of the hotel location. We are returning in May 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent staff, superb location !!!”
Reviews.Author: ScotsGlobeTrotters
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a lovely part of venice. The staff are exceptional and can direct you anywhere and make great recommendations for dinner. If you are thinking of booking and worried about location, please remember that Venice is very small and you are never too far from any of the main sites. Part of the joy of venice is walking around and exploring it! Al Sole is a perfect distance from the railway and coach station - its just over a bridge and a 5 min walk. This used to be a palace and is a beautiful building. the rooms are a little on the small side but fine for a short stay - you'll not want to spend much time in the hotel with all there is to see. If you depend on guides for restaurants etc don't bother - just ask the reception staff. Our best meals were in the ones they recommended - not the top rated ones from our Eyewitness Guide !! The Gondola's outside are expensive but you just have to !! Leave it to the end of your holiday though so you know Venice well enough to discuss routes with the gondolier to make sure you get the most from them. I only marked it down slightly because of the size of the rooms - but lead tobelieve this may be standard in venice, and I wasn't impressed with the continental breakfast, i felt there was very little choice. I'd go back in a heartbeat and stay here again as these weren't huge deal breakers for me. Also, if you leave the hotel and go to your left, along the street and take a right to a small square, over the bridge - there is Margaritta Square with lots of fab bars that stay open late and have an amazing atmosphere if sitting outside in the summer - its a must !

Reviews.Title: “this is the place to stay in venice”
Reviews.Author: brigandbob
Reviews.Content: you can do the venice experience from this hotel. if you come by, air take the water taxi as the hotel is on a canal with it's own dock. expensive, 100 euros but worth it. close to the railway station and piazzale roma for bus transport to and from the airport and cruise terminal. the rooms are comfortable and clean, some with canal views. the hotel is located in a quiet part of venice (santa croce) an area with many restaurants. from here you can take a vaporetto or walk to any part of venice. do not attermpt to take heavy baggage accross the canal bridges in this area without a porter. the staff is friendly and multi lingual. the breakfast is great , a serve yourself spread with most everything. the outdoor garden in good weather is terrific. venice guides find it easy to meet you at this hotel. our selection was great. patrizia.betto@libero.it she speaks english,german and french. we will be back for our third time in the near future and will stay at al sole!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: travellingred
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the hotel is in a fabulous location, on a little canal with a typical small Venetian bridge running over it. The location is home to a couple of gondolas so on looking out of our room we invariably saw them below our window. Whilst away from the tourist throngs the area was lively at all times, but never noisy. It is an easy ten minute walk from the railway station and within minutes of a number of quite good local restaurants. Also, S. Toma Vaporetto stop is also ten minutes away and that is only a few stops from S. Marco. The room, which we were upgraded to, was spotless, cleaned well every day, and had almost everything we needed. The only minor criticism would be the hand held shower in the bath which made it difficult to shower without soaking the bathroom. The size of the room was perfectly adequate. Breakfast was pretty good in the morning and we loved the little "garden" where we had breakfast. The jewel in the crown of this hotel would undoubtedly be the staff. They were magnificent. They were professional, friendly, and went out of their way to be helpful, particularly Linda and Luca. Thankfully we had no problems during our stay but when we needed help or advice with restaurants, bookings, or anything else, they went the extra mile with a smile. Thanks to them all. They contributed hugely to a fantastic week in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “great location excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: fredangi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this wonderful hotel four nights before our cruise. The location is close to everything especially to Plz. Roma. We could board the shuttle bus to the cruise terminal for free from there. From the Plz. Roma we bought a pass for the water bus and travelled to many places. The hotel staff members are friendly and polite. I requested a kettle for making tea and they were very nice and quick to provide that along with cups and tea bags. My room was very big with one king size bed and one single bed for the two of us. It was quiet and clean. The safety deposit was very useful. The breakfast buffet every morning was the same but delicious and plentiful. We are delighted to have stayed there. The only drawback is the internet service that were either very slow or simply not connectable. We paid 6 euros for the hour. During our stay the hotel lobby was being renovated. I am sure it's getting better with the update. Probably they would improve the WI FI service to perfect their wonderful service. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again when I visit this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view of canal and gondolas and close to Plaza Roma”
Reviews.Author: Cruisaholic21
Reviews.Content: This hotel had been a palace and was 500 years old which really made it special. We could watch the gondolas go by out of our 3rd story room. Some of the tourist even took our pictures as they went by. They had a wonderful breakfast in the courtyard which was so pleasant. The location is good since it is near the Plaza Roma, bus station, and train station. I would try to find it during the day because you only go over one bridge to get to it, but it might be a little hard to find since the sign was small. Their was a bar outside which was opened late and sometimes you could hear people talking so we took a sound machine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: donatelloUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value and in a great location, would stop here again. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hotel with wonderful location and service.”
Reviews.Author: TravelOutAbout
Reviews.Content: Hotel Al Sole is an AMAZING place to stay at! The hotel has AC. The location is close to the bus and train station. Maybe about a 10 minute was to the bus station and 15 for the train. The staff was wonderful and were very helpful! We staying in a room that had a view of the Grand Canal and the garden. The staff was so wonderful that they even prepared our bed for us. We stayed in a room for three people. There was a couch and a double bed (two twin pushed together). They first showed us our room. We went to lunch and came back, they had turned the couch into a bed and removed the bed cover and separated the beds for us. This was a delightful surprise. Just a heads up for people who like softer beds, they beds were firm. It work wonderfully for my but my friends didn't quite like the firmness of my bed as I did. The bathroom was a very good size. The shower isn't entirely enclosed. There's only one plate of glass the shield water from the shower. For a small person as myself, it didn't make a mess of things. I moved as much as would normally in my own shower. But for a bigger person, this might be a problem. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They gave us map and even outlined the quickest street that would take us to St. Mark's Square. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Venice and plan on staying at this hotel again!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Al Sole
HotelInfo.Address: Santa Croce 134-136, 30135 Venice, Italy
